alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 08 at 7:29PM MDT until August 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY... At 728 PM MDT, a confirmed tornado was located 11 miles west of Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado just north of the Yuma and Kit Carson County line. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Yuma County. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
